title: [Self-directed] Science Communication-Based Mathematics Education Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Three+ years of math-related work experience and foundational science communication comprehension
context.additional_context: Exploring methods for in-service mathematics teachers and educational experts to apply scientific communication skills in mathematics education.

learning_goals: Learners develop a 5-minute presentation explaining ≥3 complex mathematical concepts (e.g., probability, statistics, algorithms) in non-expert-friendly language using science communication theories (e.g., storytelling, visualization), achieving an "excellent" rating in ≥2 out of 3 peer assessment rubric criteria (clarity, accessibility, engagement).

Learners design three mathematics education activities applying constructivist approaches (e.g., problem-based learning, collaborative learning) and produce instructional materials meeting ≥4 out of 5 peer assessment rubric criteria (interaction facilitation, clarity of learning objectives, creativity).
Develop formative assessment tools applying social cognitive theory to measure mathematics learning effectiveness
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
